intro: Echium doderoi, commonly known as the Canary Island thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sunlight. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Echium doderoi is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
